title: Which Baskerville?
content:
I'm looking for a Baskerville (or similar) for display use. The font family should contain normal to heavy weights.

Any suggestions?

Thanks:-)

alex
author: alexfjelldal

comments.content:
If it doesn't have to be too Baskerville, Mrs Eaves is the prettiest - although you'll have to manually kern it up the wazoo. If you can drift further I might look towards Bell as well.

BTW, display Baskervilles generally come from the Fry's lineage, not the authentic JB branch. Just sayin'.

hhp
Have a look at [František Štorm’s](http://web.archive.org/web/20130817053641/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-22-baskerville-original) version of Baskerville.

Unfortunately, Matthieu Cortat's [Bonesana](http://web.archive.org/web/20130817053641/http:/www.gestalten.com/fonts/detail/?id=ceaea76523135ee601232d91c392009c) doesn't seem to have any heavy weights. It has ornamented capitals, though, which may be suited for display use.
Also take a look at Bulmer.
